Wisdom: الْمَنْقُوصُ مَسْتُورٌ عَنْهُ [مِنْهُ‏] عَيْبُهُ
enWisdom: The deficient one is he whose faults are hidden from him

Wisdom: اشْتِغَالُكَ بِمَعَايِبِ نَفْسِكَ يَكْفِيكَ الْعَارَ
enWisdom: Your preoccupation with your own flaws is sufficient to keep [the] shame [of searching for others faults] away from you

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَسْتَكْبِرَ مِنْ مَعْصِيَةِ غَيْرِكَ مَا تَسْتَصْغِرُهُ مِنْ نَفْسِكَ أَوْ تَسْتَكْثِرَ مِنْ طَاعَتِكَ مَا تَسْتَقِلُّهُ مِنْ غَيْرِكَ
enWisdom: Be cautious not to consider the sin of others as great while you deem it to be small [when it comes] from yourself, or to consider your worship as abundant while you deem the same to be less when performed by others

Wisdom: أَبْصَرُ النَّاسِ مَنْ أَبْصَرَ عُيُوبَهُ وَأَقْلَعَ عَنْ ذُنُوبِهِ
enWisdom: The most observant person is one who sees his own faults and refrains from his sins

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ النَّاسِ مَنْ شَغَلَتْهُ مَعَايِبُهُ عَنْ عُيُوبِ النَّاسِ
enWisdom: The best person is one whose own faults distract him from the faults of others

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ يُنْكِرُ عُيُوبَ النَّاسِ وَنَفْسُهُ أَكْثَرُ شَيْ‏ءٍ مَعَاباً وَلَا يُبْصِرُهَا
enWisdom: I am amazed at one who disapproves of the faults of people while he has more faults himself and does not see them

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِمَنْ يُوصَفُ بِالْخَيْرِ الَّذِي يَعْلَمُ أَنَّهُ لَيْسَ فِيهِ كَيْفَ يَرْضَى
enWisdom: I am amazed at the one who is described with a good trait that he knows is not in him, how can he be pleased?

Wisdom: كَيْفَ يُصْلِحُ غَيْرَهُ مَنْ لَا يُصْلِحُ نَفْسَهُ
enWisdom: How can one who does not reform himself reform others?!

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ كَيْساً أَنْ يَعْرِفَ مَعَايِبَهُ
enWisdom: It is a sufficient sagacity for a person to recognize his own flaws

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ كَيْساً أَنْ يَقِفَ عَلَى مَعَايِبِهِ وَيَقْتَصِدَ فِي مَطَالِبِهِ
enWisdom: It is a sufficient sagacity for a person to discover his own flaws [instead of dwelling on the flaws of others] and be moderate in what he seeks

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ شُغُلًا بِنَفْسِهِ عَنِ النَّاسِ
enWisdom: Being preoccupied with one’s soul is enough to keep a person distracted from the people

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ جَهْلًا أَنْ يَجْهَلَ عَيْبَهُ
enWisdom: It suffices as ignorance for a person to be ignorant of his flaw

Wisdom: لِيَنْهَكَ [ليهلك‏] عَنْ ذِكْرِ مَعَايِبِ النَّاسِ مَا تَعْرِفُ مِنْ مَعَايِبِكَ
enWisdom: Let that which you know of your own faults prevent you from mentioning the faults of others

Wisdom: لِيَكُفَّ مَنْ عَلِمَ مِنْكُمْ عَنْ عَيْبِ غَيْرِهِ مَا يَعْرِفُ مِنْ [عَنْ‏] عَيْبِ نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: Let what one knows of his own faults hold him back from [disclosing] what he knows of the faults of others

Wisdom: مَنْ طَلَبَ عَيْباً وَجَدَهُ
enWisdom: One who seeks a fault [in others] will find it

Wisdom: مَنْ عَلِمَ مَا فِيهِ سَتَرَ عَلَى أَخِيهِ
enWisdom: One who knows what [flaw] is in himself hides the faults of his brother

Wisdom: مَنْ أَبْصَرَ عَيْبَ نَفْسِهِ لَمْ يَعِبْ أَحَداً
enWisdom: One who sees his own faults does not fault anyone

Wisdom: مَنْ بَحَثَ عَنْ عُيُوبِ النَّاسِ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِنَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: One who is looking for the faults of people should start with himself

Wisdom: مَنْ أَنِفَ مِنْ عَمَلِهِ اضْطَرَّهُ ذَلِكَ إِلَى عَمَلٍ خَيْرٍ مِنْهُ
enWisdom: One who is not pleased with his action, is forced to perform even better

Wisdom: مَنْ أَبْصَرَ زَلَّتَهُ صَغُرَتْ عِنْدَهُ زَلَّةُ غَيْرِهِ
enWisdom: Whoever looks at his own lapses, the faults of others seem trivial to him

Wisdom: مَنْ عَمِيَ عَنْ زَلَّتِهِ اسْتَعْظَمَ زَلَّةَ غَيْرِهِ
enWisdom: Whoever is blind to his own lapses, the errors of others seem great to him

Wisdom: مَنْ شَغَلَ نَفْسَهُ بِغَيْرِ نَفْسِهِ تَحَيَّرَ فِي الظُّلُمَاتِ وَارْتَبَكَ فِي الْهَلَكَاتِ
enWisdom: Whoever preoccupies himself with other than his [own] soul falters in the darkness and becomes entangled in [a web of] destruction

Wisdom: مَنْ غَشَّ نَفْسَهُ كَانَ أَغَشَّ لِغَيْرِهِ
enWisdom: One who deceives himself is more deceitful with others

Wisdom: مِنْ أَشَدِّ عُيُوبِ الْمَرْءِ أَنْ تَخْفَى عَلَيْهِ عُيُوبُهُ
enWisdom: One of the greatest faults of a person is for his flaws to be hidden to him

Wisdom: مِنْ حَقِّ اللَّبِيبِ أَنْ يَعُدَّ سُوءَ عَمَلِهِ وَقُبْحَ سِيرَتِهِ مِنْ شَقَاوَةِ جَدِّهِ وَنَحْسِهِ
enWisdom: It is from the right of the intelligent person to count his evil action and his ugly conduct as being from the wretchedness of his circumstance and his misfortune

Wisdom: مِنْ كَمَالِ الْإِنْسَانِ وَوُفُورِ فَضْلِهِ اسْتِشْعَارُهُ بِنَفْسِهِ النُّقْصَانَ
enWisdom: From the perfection of a human being and the abundance of his merit is his own feeling of imperfection [in himself]

Wisdom: مَعْرِفَةُ الْمَرْءِ بِعُيُوبِهِ أَنْفَعُ الْمَعَارِفِ
enWisdom: A person’s cognizance of his own faults is the most beneficial knowledge

Wisdom: لَا تَعِبْ غَيْرَكَ بِمَا يَأْتِيهِ وَلَا تُعَاقِبْ غَيْرَكَ بِذَنْبٍ [عَلَى ذَنْبٍ‏] تُرَخِّصُ لِنَفْسِكَ فِيهِ
enWisdom: Do not fault others for that which you do yourself, and do not punish (or rebuke) others for the sin that you permit yourself [to indulge in]
